titles.title: Three crosses stood grimly side by side

verse.lines: On the central cross they nailed my Friend, To languish in agony; He bore it all to the bitter end â€” O wonderful love, He died for me.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: "If Thou art the Christ," they taunting, said, "Come down from the cursed tree;" He heeded no jeering word they said. But, bowing His head. He died for me.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Like a wandering sheep I had gone astray, But all my iniquity My God laid on Him that awful day, When, bearing my sins, He died for me.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Oh, thanks for the love that brought Him down. Love, fathomless, like the sea; His brow was pierced by a thorny crown. That a crown of life might be given me.

verse.name: v7
